meanings.definition: To catch or hook with a cleek.
meanings.sent1: She cleeked the fish from the pond with her fishing rod.
meanings.sent2: He cleeked the key from the hook on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The clever cat cleeked the toy mouse from the shelf.
meanings.sent4: Her words cleeked my attention, drawing me into the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The magnet cleeked the metal paperclips effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: The chains cleeked together, forming a strong bond.
meanings.sent2: She cleeked arms with her friends in solidarity.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces cleeked perfectly, completing the picture.
meanings.sent4: Their hearts cleeked as they shared a special moment.
meanings.sent5: The train cars cleeked as they joined on the tracks.

meanings.sent1: The mischievous raccoon cleeked some snacks from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent2: He cleeked a glance at the secret document on the desk.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel cleeked a nut from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: She cleeked a kiss from him when he least expected it.
meanings.sent5: The thief cleeked the precious jewel from the museum.
